edu.up.cs301.game.config
Class GameConfig

java.lang.Object
  edu.up.cs301.game.config.GameConfig

public class GameConfig
extends java.lang.Object

GameConfig class

This class describes a user-specified configuration for playing a game. It includes information about the number and type of players in the game and other related meta-data. A game initializes this class with some information and additional data is provided by the user or loaded from a previously-saved configuration.

Version:
July 2013
Author:
Andrew Nuxoll, Steven R. Vegdahl
See Also:
GameMainActivity

Constructor Detail

GameConfig

public GameConfig(java.util.ArrayList<GamePlayerType> availTypes,
                  int minPlayers,
                  int maxPlayers,
                  java.lang.String gameName,
                  int portNum)
to create an instance of this class initial values for some instance variables must be supplied. The constructor makes a cursory effort to catch and fix bad input but, ultimately, the caller is responsible for creating a proper game definition. In particular, you must call addPlayer sufficient times to make sure that the minimum number of players is met.

This is the version of the constructor that is expected to be called when the game activity starts. It therefore automatically adds a "Network Player" player-type option, which always becomes the last element in the available-player list.

This constructor leave the list of local players empty, and sets the remote player to have a type that corresponds to the first player in the available-player list. These defaults can (and probably should) be changed by calling 'addPlayer' and 'setRemoteData'.

Parameters:
availTypes - the list of available player types (excluding the network player, which is added by the constructor
minPlayers - the minimum number of players allowed in this game
maxPlayers - the maximum number of players allowed in this game
gameName - the name of the game
portNum - the port number used by this game for connecting over the network

public void setRemoteData(java.lang.String playerName,
                          java.lang.String ipCode,
                          int menuIndex)
set the remove-player data

Parameters:
playerName - the remote player's name
ipCode - the IP code used by the remote player
menuIndex - the index in the available-player array that denotes this player's type

saveConfig

public boolean saveConfig(java.lang.String fileName,
                          GameMainActivity activity)
Saves this configuration data in a file so that it can be later reused. The format used is a sequence of serialized objects: - a Boolean that denotes whether the "Local Game" tab was selected - the name of the remote player (String) - the type of the remote player (String, which is the menu-text that denotes the type) - the IP code for the remote player (String) - the list of player names (ArrayList) - a sequence of N Strings that denote the (menu-text) for the respective player types, where N is the number of elements in the list of player names

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file for storing
activity - the current activity
Returns:
a boolean that denotes whether the operation was successful

restoreSavedConfig

public boolean restoreSavedConfig(java.lang.String fileName,
                                  GameMainActivity activity)
Saves this configuration data in a file so that it can be later reused. The format used listed in the method-header comment for the 'saveConfig' method.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file that contains the configuration information
activity - the current activity
Returns:
a boolean that denotes whether the operation was successful
